intro: Prestonia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
